This function takes three arguments: The first argument is the object within a collection The second argument is a ref argument which should be set to a value used for the Max function. The third argument is a ref argument which should be set to a value used for the Min function.
Returns true to indicate that the Max and Min function should be called, else false to not call the Max/Min functions.
A transformer function that determines the assocated value. If the second argument is true, this is for a maximum value.
member.returns: Returns a Tuple instance where Item1 is the Max value and Item2 is the Min Value.

member.name: M:Common.LinqExtensions.Pearson(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Pearson's chi square test is used to assess two types of comparisons: tests of goodness of fit, and tests of independence. In other words, it is a measure of how well a sample distribution matches a predicted distribution or the degree of correlation between two sample distributions. Pearson's is often used in scientific applications to test the validity of hypotheses.

member.name: M:Common.LinqExtensions.Pearson(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Decimal},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Pearson's chi square test is used to assess two types of comparisons: tests of goodness of fit, and tests of independence. In other words, it is a measure of how well a sample distribution matches a predicted distribution or the degree of correlation between two sample distributions. Pearson's is often used in scientific applications to test the validity of hypotheses.

member.name: M:Common.Mail.ParseMailAddressString(System.Net.Mail.MailAddressCollection,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Updates the mail address collection based on the address string. Each address must be separated with either a comma (,) or semicolon (;).
If the comma or semicolon is within a quoted string or parentheses, it will be ignored and treated as part of the email address.
member.param: MailAddressCollection that will be updated
A comma or semicolon delimited string of email addresses
if true (default), the email addresses are check and if invalid it will NOT be added to the address collection.

if true (default), the first invalid email address will result in an FormatException being thrown. if false, all invalid email addresses will be ignored.
This parameter is only valid when checkAddress is true.

member.summary: Determines if address is RFC822 complaint
member.param: email address to be validated
member.returns: true if complaint; false otherwise

member.name: M:Common.MaxMinDateTime.CompareTo(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns -1 if compareDateTime is greater than the Max DateTime Returns 1 if the compareDateTime is less than the Min DateTime Returns 0 to indicate that the compareDateTime is within the Range (IsBetween) of the Max and Min DateTimes.

member.name: M:Common.MaxMinDateTime.CompareTo(Common.MaxMinDateTime)
member.summary: Returns 0 if the MaxMinDateTime instances are the same. Returns 1 to indicated that the compareMaxMinDateTime instance "Over Laps" "this" instance (the Max and Min values are greater than the Max and Min values of "this" instance) Returns -1 to indicated that the "this" instance "Over Laps" compareMaxMinDateTime instance (the Max and Min values are greater than the Max and Min values of compareMaxMinDateTime instance) Otherwise, it returns 1 if "this" instance's time span is greater than compareMaxMinDateTime's time span. -1 is returned if the time span is less than "this" instance.
member.example: MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/15/2012}) returns -1 MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/01/2012}) returns 1 (Time Span between 3/1/2012 and 4/12/2012 is greater than 3/10/2012 and 4/1/2012) MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{02/10/2012,04/15/2012}) returns -1 (Time Span between 3/1/2012 and 4/12/2012 is less than 2/10/2012 and 4/15/2012) MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}) returns 0 (Same Date and Times) MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/15/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}) returns 1

member.name: M:Common.MaxMinDateTime.IsBetween(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns true if checkDateTime is greater than or equal to the Min value and less than or equal to the Max value.
member.param: The DateTime value that will be chaecked against the Min and Max range
member.returns: true if checkDateTime is between the Min and Max range

member.name: M:Common.MaxMinDateTime.IsBetween(Common.MaxMinDateTime)
member.summary: Returns true is the checkMaxMinDateTime instance is between "this" instance's Max and Min DateTime (inclusive)

member.name: M:Common.MaxMinDateTime.OverLaps(Common.MaxMinDateTime)
member.summary: Returns 0 to indicated that either the instances are equal or one of the instances isBetween the Min/Max value of the other. Returns 1 to indicated that the maxminDateTimeOverLap instance "Over Laps" this instance (the Max and Min values are greater than the Max and Min values of "this" instance) Returns -1 to indicated that the "this" instance "Over Laps" maxminDateTimeOverLap instance (the Max and Min values are greater than the Max and Min values of maxminDateTimeOverLap instance)
member.example: MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/15/2012}) returns -1 MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/01/2012}) returns 0 (argument instance IsBetween 3/1/2012 and 4/12/2012) MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}) returns 0 (Same Date and Times) MaxMinDateTime{03/10/2012,04/15/2012}.OverLaps(MaxMinDateTime{03/01/2012,04/12/2012}) returns 1

member.name: T:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments
member.summary: Allows the association of multiple SQL connection string to predefined (i.e., Development, QA, Production) and user defined environment keywords.
member.remarks:
This manages a collection of adapters where each adapters' connection string is set based on the current environment's connection string.
Each Data Adapter must inherit from IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport... When using a Table Adapter Manager, it must inherit from IMultipleDataAdapterConnectionAgent...

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.HostName
member.summary: The Host Name of the "Current" Environment's Connection String Host

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.ClosePriorConnection
member.summary: If true the prior connection is closed before switching to the new connection environment.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environment
member.summary: Gets the current environment or sets the environment to the given value. Null can be set, which indicates no environment set.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Item(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Gets the associated connection string or null to indicate that there is no associations. Sets the environment to the given connection string.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.ProductionConnectionString
member.summary: Sets/Gets the Production Environment's connection string.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.DevleopmentConnectionString
member.summary: Sets/Gets the Development Environment's connection string.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.QAConnectionString
member.summary: Sets/Gets the QA's Environment's connection string.

member.name: P:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.DataAdapters
member.summary: Sets/Gets an array of Associated Data Adapters. If setting value is null, all adapters are removed.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Enabled(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Determines if the environment is enabled
member.param: The environment to check
member.returns: True to indicate that the environment is enabled. If the environment is NOT defined, false is returned.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Enabled(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the Enabled status of the environment.
member.param: The environment's enable status to set
The enable status
member.returns: Returns the value of enabled
member.remarks: If environment is not defined, it is created with the enabled status.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Add(Common.IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the data adapter to the adapter collection for connection string environment management.
member.param: Data Adapter
If true (default), the adapter's connection string is set to the current environment's connection string. If false the adapter's connection string is NOT set but is added to the collection.
member.returns: True to indicate that is was added. False to indicate that the adapter was already in the collection

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Common.IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a collection of adapters to the adapter collection for connection string environment management.
member.param: A data adapter collection to associate with the management collection
If true (default), the adapter's connection string is set to the current environment's connection string. If false the adapter's connection string is NOT set but is added to the collection.
member.returns: True to indicate at least one adapter was added.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Remove(Common.IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport)
member.summary: Removes the adapter from the managed collection.
member.param: The adapter that will be removed
member.returns: True to indicate that it was removed.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.RemoveAllDataAdapters
member.summary: Removes all adapters from the manged collection.
member.returns: True to indicate that all adapters were removed.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.SetConnectionString(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Common.IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport})
member.summary: Associates the environment with given connection string and current collection of adapters or the given collection of adapters.
member.param:
The environment keyword associated with the connection string.
If Environments.All is given, the connection string is associated with all defined environments based on the given adapters.
The connection string
If null (default), the current adapter collection is associated with this environment. If not null, the collection of adapters are associated with this environment.
member.remarks: If the environment is already defined, the connection string is replaced with this connection string. The associated adapters are update with the current adapters or the given adapters.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.RemoveEnvironment(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Removes the environment.
member.param: The environment that will be removed
member.returns: True to indicate that it was removed.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.RemoveAllEnvironments
member.summary: Remove all environments.
member.returns: True to indicate that all environments were removed

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.GetConnectionString(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Returns the connection string for the environment.
member.param: Connection String for the given environment
member.returns: The connection string or null when the environment is not defined

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.GetConnectionHostName(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Returns the connection string host for the environment
member.param: The host of the given environment
member.returns: The connection host for the given environment. Null to indicate that the environment was not defined.

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.IsEnvironmentCurrent(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments)
member.summary: Determine if the given environment is the current environment or not...
member.param: Environment to check
member.returns: True to indicate that it is or false that it is not

member.name: M:Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.MakeEnvironmentCurrent(Common.MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments.Environments,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Common.IDataAdapterMultipleConnectionSupport},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the given environment the current environment setting the connection string of the associated adapters or only the adapters given.
member.param: Environment to make the current
Null (default), to set the associated adapters' connection string. A collection of adapters where only these adapters' connection string are set based on this environment.

If true (default false), the adapters' connection string are always updated regardless of the current environment setting. If false (default) and if the current environment is the same as this environment, the adapters' connection strings are NOT updated.
member.returns: True to indicate that the current environment is now the given environment.

member.summary: This interface is used to define an association between a Table Adapter Manager and a MultipleDataAdapterHostEnvironments object.

members.member:
\ \
Helper class used to parse a string and substitute inline tags/parameters with system and/or user defined values.
For more information see also .

Parses the given string resolving any inline tags/parameters.
String that will be parsed, substituting predefined or user supplied tags (parameters) with current values of those tags. If not null (default is null), a key\-value pair collection where the key is the parameter name (tag) and the value associated with this tag. If not null (default is null), a regular express that is used to identify tags. if null (default), the system default will be used (see ). The default identifies tags/parameters by starting '[' and ending ']'. If True (default), the standard system tags (parameters) are used for substitution. If false, only the user defined collection is used (substituteVarNameValueCollection).
A tag/parameter is identified by starting '[' and ending ']' characters when using the system defined regular express.
\Examples of tags are [LoggedInUser], [MyDocuments], etc.
If the tag/parameter is not identified, that tag is not substituted and returned in the string.
A completely parsed string where each inline tag/parameter is substituted with the current system/user value.
__________________________________________________ Note: Below are the System Defined Tags/Parameters:
Tag/Parameter \Summary Comments Name ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ AssemblyDir The See directory of the loaded exe Assembly. This is similar to AssemblyLocation, except that a normalized direction string is returned. Null can be returned. AssemblyFullName The Full See See name of the loaded exe Assembly. Null can be returned. AssemblyLocation Gets the See See full path or UNC location of the loaded \file that contains the manifest. Null can be returned. ApplicationName,
AppName The See
See application name that See is determined Property by first looking at the Assembly Product Attribute's Product property of the Assembly. If this is null, the current Domain's friendly name (removes the "exe" from the name). ApplicationUserProfile,
AppUserProfile Defined as See "[MyDocuments]\\[ApplicationName]".
Enumeration ApplicationVersion,
AppVersion,
AppVer The See
See Application \version Property. See (v.v.v.v) of the Property. See executing assembly. Method. See The version is first Method determined by looking at the Assembly \Version Attribute's \Version property. If this is null, the entry assembly's name object's \Version property is used. Null can be returned. ApplicationVersionName,
ApplicationVerName,
AppVersionName,
AppVerName Defined as "[ApplicationName]_[DeploymentVersion]". CompanyName The name of See
See the Company as defined Property. in the Assembly. This is determined by looking at the Assembly Company Attribute's Company property. Null can be returned. CurrentDir,
CurrentDirectory,
CurrDir The Current See Working Method Directory which can be different from where the Application started. This value is based on the System.IO.Directory.GetCurrentDirectory() method. DeploymentLocation,
DeployLocation,
DeploymentLoc,
DeployLoc The See Directory Property. See Location of where the Property Deployment Package was/is being deployed. This is determined by looking at the Application Deployment Update's Location property. If null, string "." is returned, otherwise a local directory is returned. DeploymentLocationData,
DeployLocData The See Directory Property. See location of where the Property data portion of the deployment package is located. This is determined by looking at the Application Deployment Update's DataDirectory property. A local directory is returned or null is returned. DeploymentVersion,
DeploymentVer,
DeployVer The See Deployment Class. See \Version of the Property. See Deployment Package. If Property there is no Deployment Package (version) the Application's \Version is used. This is determined by looking at the Application Deployment's Current Deployment property's \Current \Version property. If this is null, the Application \Version property's value is used.
DomainName The name of See
See the Domain the users belongs to. If the user does not belong to a domain the computer's Name is used. This is determined by looking at the system environment's User Domain Name. If null the LocalHostName name is used. DomainFQ The Fully See
See qualified Domain name Method. See of the Domain this Property computer belongs to. This is based on the network IP global's DomainName property. LocalHostFullName The Fully See
Qualified Name of this Computer including domain. This \returns either the fully qualified host name (hostname.dns), domain-host format (domain\\host), or just the host name. LocalHostIPAddress The IP 4 See address (x.x.x.x) of the local host. If there is no network adapter, null is returned. If there are network adapters defined and if there is an error trying to get the IP 4 the loop back IP address is used. LocalHostName The name of See this Local Host (without domain). The name is determined by looking at the system global IP's HostName property. If null, system Dns's GetHostName() method, or the system Environment's MachineName property. LocalHostNameFQDN The Fully See Qualified Name of this Computer including domain. If the domain does not exists just the name of this computer. \Returns either the fully qualified host name (hostname.dns) or just the host name. LoggedInUser The user See name of the logged in User with domain (domain\\userid). MachineName The NetBIOS See name of Property this local computer. This uses the Environment's MachineName property. OperatingSystemVersion,
OSVersion The name of See the current Property. See OS Version (e.g., Property "Microsoft Windows NT 6.0.6002 Service Pack 2"). This uses the Environment's OSVersion property. OSPlatformId The OS See platform id Property as defined by Microsoft. ProcessId The process See . See id of the Method current process. This uses the Diagnostics Process's get Current Process Id method. StartUpDirectory,
StartUpDir The See
See directory Method
See where the Process/Application Property started. This value is determined by the Diagnostics Process's StartInfo property. UserName The display See name of the Property
See logged in user. This first looks at the Environment's UserName property. If null, the CurrentUserName's value is used. WorkingDirectory,
WorkingDir,
WorkDir \Returns See the fully Property qualified path of the current working directory. $"EnvironmentVariableName" \Returns See the Method environment variable's value. (note that quotes should not be included in the name). \Examples are: [$PATH], [$HOMEDRIVE] "EnvironmentSpecialFolderName" An argument See Enumeration name that represents the System.Environment.SpecialFolder Enumeration value.
Examples are: [MyComputer], [MyMusic], [CommonApplicationData], [LocalApplicationData], [MyDocuments], [ProgramFiles], [CommonProgramFiles]
Note that quotes should not be included in the name Search("DirList" A "special" \Examples:
Search(c:[MyDocuments];c:docs;\\networkhostdocs , function , "FileList") that takes myFile.doc;company.doc)

member.name: T:Common.ReflectionInfo.ArrayPlaceHolder
member.summary: An argument placeholder for methods that is used for passing arrays or params to a method. You can always use the system array type when using Method Arguments, but this type is used to evaluate each element in this object when the GetValue, SetValue or Invoke is executed.
member.remarks: When working with params you must send in an object array or use this wrapper!

member.name: T:Common.ReflectionInfo.ArrayPlaceHolder`1

member.name: F:Common.ReflectionInfo.NoArgumentValueGivenHolder

member.name: P:Common.ReflectionInfo.Parameters

member.name: P:Common.ReflectionInfo.MethodArguments
member.summary: If defined and if no arguments are passed to a method on a SetValue, GetValue, or Invoke method call, these argument will be used to call the method.
member.remarks: This array can be used by the consumer to loop through looking for ArgumentPlaceHolders or NoArgumentValuePlaceHolders and substituting those value for the proper values and than passing this new array on to the target ReflectionInfo method. In this manner the Place Holder objects are persevered for similar processing.

member.summary:
Used to indicate that any Method Arguments should be evaluated first looking for any argument place holds (e.g., ThisPlaceHolder) or IReflectionInfo objects so that these items can be evaluated and substituted in the actual arguments supplied to the method.
True to indicate evaluate Method Argument, false (default) to indicate do not evaluate.

Parameters that will be passed to a method. Ignored for properties.
Null to use the value of EvaluateMethodArgumentsUponExecution property. True to evaulate method arguments and false not to evaulate method arguments

member.remarks: Note that a null can be returned to indicate failure.

For static methods this field is ignored.
New Value to set
member.returns: Returns the new value of the property or the return value of the method.
member.remarks: Note that a null can be returned to indicate failure.

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfo.Invoke(System.Object,System.Object[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Invokes the associates property (i.e., calls GetValue) or executes the associated method.
member.param: The target instance of the property or method. For extended static methods this should be passed with the proper target instance and the ThisArgumentHolder must be the first argument for parameters and evaluateMethodArgumentsUponGetValue must be true. For static methods this field is ignored.
Parameters that will be passed to a method. Ignored for properties.
Null to use the value of EvaluateMethodArgumentsUponExecution property. True to evaulate method arguments and false not to evaulate method arguments

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfoHelper.GetMethodInfoFromString(System.Type,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object}@,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a MethodInfo object based on the methodString and baseType given.
member.param: The type where the method is declared
the method string including any arguments. If arguments are present they have to be either the Type name or a value where the cast is the Type name
returns a colleciton of the actual argument values if given
the full name of the assembly where the data types can be found
member.returns: MethodInfo object or null indicating that the method string is not a method or could not be found
member.remarks:
methodString can take several different formats used to override the baseType. They are:
::ClassName.FunctionName() -- In this format baseType will be overridden with the ClassName's type. baseType's namespace will be used to get to ClassName's type.
::+SubClassName.FunctionName() -- In this format baseType will be overridden with the SubClassName's type. +SubClassName.FunctionName() In this case SubClassName must be a sub-class of the baseType
global::Namespace.NameSpace1.ClassName.FunctionName() -- In this format baseType is override with the ClassName's type. In this form a fully qualified class name, including assembly, can be given. If defaultAssembly is not provide the baseType's assembly is used as the default but will not override the assembly if this is given in this form.

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfoHelper.CreateReflectionInfoFromString(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,Common.ReflectionInfo},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a collection of Key/Value Pair where the Key is the Type and Value is a ReflectionInfo Instance. This method parses typeNameDelimiterString into the Key/Value Pair
member.param: A string where the first item is a Fully Qualified Type Name or System Type separated by a semicolon. The Second Item is a list of public properties and/or methods separated by commas and/or keywords. Keywords are: <All> <AllProperties> <AllMethods> <Default> Additional pairs can be included separated by semicolons. Example: MyNameSpace.MySubNameSpace.MyClass,MyAssembleQualifiedName;MyProperyA, MyPropertyB, MyFunctionA(), MyFunctionB(10);MyNameSpace.MySubNameSpace.MyOtherClass,MyAssembleQualifiedName;<ALL>

If given, This collection will be used to merge the parsed typeNameDelimiterString into. Duplicates will not be added to this collection. This collection is returned! If NOT given, a new collection is created and returned.

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfoHelper.ParseArgumentValueToString(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a String representation of the argValue properly delimited. For example in the case of an array an string of all elements are returned...
member.param: The value that will be translated to a string
True (default) the Database date/time string indicators are used (i.e., #). False uses the .Net string delimiater (i.e., ") (
member.returns: A string representation of the argValue
member.remarks: If argValue is a class or structure the ToString method for that object is returned. If argValue is a ReflectionInfo.IArgumentPlaceHolder, the place holder(s) will be properly parsed and returned.

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfoHelper.ParseIntoMethodNameWithArgumenst(Common.ReflectionInfo,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Translate a ReflectionInfo object into it"s DisplayName plus any arguments including argument placeholders.
member.param: ReflectionInfo instance
A string that represents chained execution items or parent/namespace nodes.
If true (default), the reflection item"s base type full name is appended to the display name only when it is a static item.

Only valid when includeFullClassName is true.
If false (default true), item"s base type name (not full name) is used.
member.returns: A string that includes the DisplayName plus arguments and/or argument placeholders.

member.name: M:Common.ReflectionInfoHelper.ParseAssemblyQualifiedClassNameIntoParts(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Parses an Assembly Qualified Class Name into the fully qualified class and the assembly name.
If Assembly Qualified Class Name is just a class name, the class name is returned and assembly name is null.

member.name: M:Common.StringFunctions.IndexWhenDifferent(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Compares each string (by character) until a character in string-b does not match the character in string-a at that same position.
member.param: string used to compare against string-b
the string used to match agains string-a
One of the enumeration values that specifies the rules for the search.
member.returns: Returns -1 if the strings match all characters or when string-a is null or empty Returns the position when the two strings do not match. If string b is empty or null, 0 is returned. Note that the length of string-a can be returned if string-b's length is greater than string-a and all character match up to string's length.

example.code: "12345678".IndexWhenDifferent("1234a") => 4 "12345678".IndexWhenDifferent("1234") => -1 "1234".IndexWhenDifferent("12345678") => 4 "1234".IndexWhenDifferent("1a345678") => 1

member.summary:
Parses a string into a numeric object. This can include hex strings and numeric literals (positioned as the last character in a numeric value).
Numeric Literals are: F or f -- Float U or u -- unsigned int L or l -- long UL or ul -- unsigned long M or m -- Decimal
member.param: A string that can contain numbers, commas, decimal point, numeric literal, and an optional sign. If a character is NOT one of these false is returned and numericValue is null.
null to indicate that the possibleNumeric was not a number or a numeric object

If true the best numeric type is determined and returned based on the value range of the numeric. If false this option is not performed.
This is only valid for integer values where a numeric literal is NOT provided. The default is false.

If true and if the value properly fits in the default data type of int, int is returned. If false this option is not performed. If findBestNumericType is true this options is not performed.
This is only valid for integer values where a numeric literal is NOT provided. The default is false.
member.returns: true to indicate that the value has been parsed into a numeric object.
member.remarks: If a Numeric Literals is provided that associated data type is returned. If a hex string value is provide a long or ulong is returned.

member.name: M:Common.StringFunctions.RemoveConsecutiveChar(System.String,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove any found consecutive characters in the string.
member.param: String to search for consecutive characters
Character to remove (if convective). The default is a space.
If false (default), one consecutive character is inserted. If true, all consecutive characters are removed.
member.returns: string where the consecutive characters have been removed.
member.example:
Removing spaces (default), removeAllConsecutiveChars is false (default) "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def"
Removing plus signs (+), removeAllConsecutiveChars is false (default) "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "123 456 789 0 abc + + + def"
Removing plus signs (+) where removeAllConsecutiveChars is true "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "123 456 789 0 abc def"

member.name: M:Common.StringFunctions.RemoveConsecutiveChar(System.String,System.Char[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove any found consecutive characters in the string.
member.param: String to search for consecutive characters
Characters to remove (if convective).

If true (default), all characters in removeChars are treated as one consecutive character and will be removed. If false, each individual character in removeChars is treated as one consecutive group and that group will be removed.
If false (default), one consecutive character is inserted. If true, all consecutive characters are removed.
member.returns: string where the consecutive characters have been removed.
member.example:
Removing spaces and pluses where anyConsecutiveCharOrder is true (default) and removeAllConsecutiveChars is false (default) "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "123 456 789 0 abc def"
Removing + where anyConsecutiveCharOrder is false and removeAllConsecutiveChars is false (default) "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "123 456 789 0 abc + + + def"
Removing spaces and pluses where anyConsecutiveCharOrder is true (default) and removeAllConsecutiveChars is true "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "1234567890abcdef"
Removing spaces and pluses where anyConsecutiveCharOrder is false and removeAllConsecutiveChars is true "123 456 789 0 abc + +++ + def" ==> "1234567890abcdef" Note that the same result will occur regardless of the anyConsecutiveCharOrder value when removeAllConsecutiveChars is true!

member.returns: Escape String either with the C# shortcut escape or the \uxxxx format.
member.remarks: C# defines the following character escape sequences: \' - single quote, needed for character literals \" - double quote, needed for string literals \\ - backslash \0 - Unicode character 0 \a - Alert (character 7) \b - Backspace (character 8) \f - Form feed (character 12) \n - New line (character 10) \r - Carriage return (character 13) \t - Horizontal tab (character 9) \v - Vertical quote (character 11) \uxxxx - Unicode escape sequence for character with hex value xxxx \xn[n][n][n] - Unicode escape sequence for character with hex value nnnn (variable length version of \uxxxx) \Uxxxxxxxx - Unicode escape sequence for character with hex value xxxxxxxx (for generating surrogates)

member.summary: This is a special static utility class used like a switch statement in cased where you need to check a object's type and execute code based on a collection of types.

member.name: M:Common.TypeSwitch.Test(System.Object,Common.TypeSwitch.CaseInfo[])
member.summary: The static method used to execute the System.Type cases. Execution is in order of the define cases.
member.param: The object's type that will be tested
A set of System.Type caes used to "test" the object's type and execution the action if a match occurs
member.remarks: If a default case is defined, it is always executed as the last action in the testCases collection.

member.name: M:Common.TypeSwitch.Case``1(System.Action)
member.summary: Defines a System.Type case and if the object's type matches or is a subclass of this type, action is executed.
member.typeparam: the test System.Type used to determine if a match occurs
member.param: The action that is executed if the System.Types match.
member.returns: An internal structure

member.name: M:Common.XmlHelper.GetDataTable(System.Xml.XmlNodeList,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a list of Xml nodes to a DataTable and sets one of the columns as a primary key.

member.name: M:Common.XmlHelper.UpdateChildNodesWithDataTable(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the child nodes of "parentNode" by using the fields from a datatable.
member.param: The column name of the datatable that acts as a primary key.
member.remarks: The child nodes that will be updated must have attribute fields that correspond to the DataTable. The "keyField" will be used to identify the attribute that serves as an identifier of the rows. The datatable can have less fields than the nodes so you have the chance to update smaller subsets. Make sure that you did not call "AcceptChanges" before passing the datatable or this function will not find any change.

member.name: M:Common.XmlHelper.UpdateChildNodesWithDataTable(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Update child nodes with data from datatable. Note that the datatable requires a primary key column defined.
